structure.unit: The General Laws, And Express Repeal Of Certain Acts And Resolves
The General Laws And Their Effect

law.catch_line: Construction Of General Laws As Continuation Of Former Acts
law.text: The provisions of the General Laws, so far as they are the same as those of existing statutes, shall be construed as a continuation thereof and not as new enactments, and a reference in a statute which has not been repealed to provisions of law which are revised and re-enacted herein shall be construed as applying to such provisions as so incorporated in the General Laws.
